intro: Byrsella hystrix, commonly known as the spiny hakea, is a shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, spiny foliage and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant has woody stems with a rough, bark-like texture and produces small, leathery leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates with dry summers. Byrsella hystrix is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and hardy nature.
